page.title: 11WHALEY QUARRY.
page.content: Whaley Quarry produces Magnesium Limestone of which 85% is used as sub-base material in road building. The quarry floor covers an area of 10 acres and the quarry face is 65 feet high. To begin work the top soil, { {(overburden)}is removed by caterpiller tractors and scraper. 8 holes 4\ inches in diameter and 65 feet deep are drilled and filled with explosives to blast the face. One tonne of explosive is used for each blast which takes place once a week. The stone is crushed and screened into four sizes and sold at around Â£4 per tonne plus transport costs. Whaley is a small quarry which employs nine people including office staff. It is a part of the Tarmac Roadstone group of companies.
